definition: gradually/little by little/in the course of time
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
two/2/(Beijing dialect) stupid

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: As they often play football together, they have got to know each other quite well.
sentences.chinese: 他们常在一起踢足球，一来二去地也就熟了。

to get familiar with
every few days (idiom)
over time/as time passes/in the fullness of time

unfamiliar at first, but well accustomed soon enough (idiom)

afterwards/later
to be able to talk to/to get along with/to be congenial

to be kindred spirits/to hit it off
not to hold anything back (idiom)/(of close friends etc) to tell each other everything
friends despite the difference in age
lit. to be together from the first beat (idiom)/to hit it off/to click together/to chime in easily
